content.description: Crux on this is the first move, reaching over and pulling yourself up, great hand holds and footing, a fun lil scramble.
content.location: This line is just to the left of the descent landing rock, start on the over hang nice footing on the little ledges underneath

content.description: The crux here is coming up over the ledge, it's a tough pull with negligible leg leverage. So far my favorite route on this boulder, tricky and rewarding, and on the warm side of the rock so good vitamin D.
content.location: This route is located on the far left side of the under house face. Start off the rock, grab the ledge and then pull up for your foot holds, from here it's alot of arm power as you reach over and grab your next hold and continue to pull yourself over the ledge and up to grab a nice foot hold that's right near the tip of the nose. Up and over the top to the hop down descent on the shady side.

content.description: Left arete while looking at the boulder from the water. Small right hand crimp and a low left hand pinch make the start. Dyno to the flat edge and top out. Grade may be a bit soft. Time will tell...if anyone else ever climbs it haha
On the right side of the Southside overhang.  Grab a spike and campus up to a jug.  Make a crux move moving up on the slab.  Climb the glory slab up to the house.
content.location: Right side of the massive south side overhang.

content.description: Hand holds on the ledge runs right to left with a crack running along at foot lvl, the crux is about halfway across, the ledge rounds out and your footing is almost not existant basically your on all arms.
content.location: Under the house far right of the face, start on ledge hand holds and hop your feet up to crack, progress left moving with the ledge and the crack, up and over the ledge right before you hit your head on the house ;) To get down you can follow the ledge back and then you have a short hop down to a nice flat rock after shimmying to the edge.

content.description: Stand start with a good right hand edge, and a poor left hand crimp.  Climb straight up the artee on generally good holds.  Some of the rock is a bit grainy and crumbly.  A lower start down and left starting matched on an obvious right facing just left of the arete adds some good climbing and bumps the grade to v6/7ish. House Arete Video
content.location: Obvious tall arete on the House Boulder

content.description: Same start as Kneeds but traverse left and then up the slick slab.  Classic.Cloud Knees Video
Left corner of the overhanging face. Start low and right on decent crimps, move Left for 10ft or so to the last bit of the lower ledge and make a deadpoint for the lip and top out on the overhang

This is a huge granite rock with a strange lil house perched on it. Seems to be granite quartz mix like most of the boulders in this area, can be very slippery and ruff on the fingers but offers some good holds and interesting formations. Under the house is alot of old tires and some very tetnis looking rusted metal, some of which we moved some is more deeply embedded only is sketchy for one line we were attempting, the rest of the base is other rocks and beach. Mostly secluded with occasional atv's passing by presumedly to go clamming ?
